page.title: 06Housing Survey
page.content: Within Holderness as a whole there are 16 359 households and with Preston there are about 700 houses, of this number approximately 490 are privately owned and about 210 are rented either from the council or from private individuals. The housing types are a complete mixture ranging from farmhouses dating from the 18th Centure to modern 2 bedroomed bungalows. A proportion of the post-war council houses are asbestos clad and were constructed using quick non-traditional methods. The oldest house in our area dates back to the 1680's
